text: Hello. I'm Lisa. Welcome. There's no rush here. Take a moment to settle in. When you're ready, I'd love to hear what's bringing you here.
I had a really bad experience last year - someone I trusted betrayed me. I thought I was over it, but it keeps coming up in my dreams.

Thank you for trusting me with this. Betrayal wounds deeply - they shake our foundation of trust in others and ourselves. Dreams often process what we can't during the day. How do you feel when you wake from these dreams?
Scared and alone. Like it happened yesterday.

That makes sense - trauma lives in the body as much as the mind. Let's try a gentle grounding exercise. Can you place your feet flat on the floor and notice the solidness beneath you? This is called 'resourcing' - building a sense of safety in the present moment.
Okay... I feel more stable now.
Good. Your body knows how to find safety. Trauma responses are adaptive - they kept you safe then. But they don't serve us when the danger has passed. What coping strategies have you found helpful?
Walking helps sometimes. And talking to friends.
Those are wonderful resources. Movement and connection are powerful healers. Let's build on that. Would you be open to trying a simple somatic exercise before bed? It might help with the dreams.
I think so. What would that involve?
Just gentle touch - placing your hand on your heart and saying 'I am safe now.' We'll go slowly, at your pace. Healing happens in these small, compassionate moments.
